data.title: Quetzal Flores: Celebrating 30 Years of Music and Artivism - The Real Talk Podcast
meta_keywords: Quetzal Flores: Celebrating 30 Years of Music and Artivism
data.meta_description:
Real Talk host Matt Munoz takes you on a musical journey to explore the birth of the groundbreaking band Quetzal in 90s era Los Angeles through fascinating insights about how cultural and political movements played a crucial role in the evolution of the band’s music, helping give voice to a new musical youth movement.

The band's musical director Quetzal Flores also details how the traditional music of Son Jarocho from Veracruz, Mexico, was rescued from modernity and how it helped reshape the Southern California music scene.

Our interview also touches on the challenges faced by the band in the music industry, and how they managed to maintain their musical authenticity despite industry pressures. Finally, we reflect on the band’s 30 years of making music and art in the City of Angels – PLUS a preview of the band’s 30th anniversary celebration happening Saturday, August 19th, 2023 at La Plaza de Cultura y Artes in DTLA! / Official Websites: https://quetzalela.com / http://www.quetzalflores.com/

This episode features the following Quetzal music/sound clips: -“Tragafuegos” (Fire Breathers)
-“55th Grammy Awards, 2013” Red Carpet interview
-“Chicana Skies”
-“Los Pollos” (artist: Son de Madera)
-“The Social Relevance of Public Art”
-“Planta de Los Pies” (Soles)
-“Justice Never Dies”
-“La Guia” (The Guide)
-“El Rio” (The River)
-“Witness"

Catch Real Talk, every Friday from 10am to 12pm PST on FORGE 103.9FM (Kern County, CA) or stream anywhere on FORGE1039.COM.

Host: Matt Munoz
